title: Lag problems since 8.2
body: Ever since the 8.2 update I have had really bad lag issues. I regularly have about a 60 ping that remains consistent, but since the update it is all over the place and jumps between 60 and 800 every min.

replies.body:
Let's test a few things to see if we can get that ping smoothed out around 60 again. One good step I like to try first is switching your DNS server settings to 8.8.8.8/8.8.4.4 to get a clearer signal to Googles servers first. After that, test it out in a custom game to see if it helps or not.

If that's not helping, we might need to dig a little deeper to see what's wrong. There could possibly be some issues with packet loss, and a traceroute could help pinpoint that. You can get that done by using [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and running a trace to 104.160.131.1, then post those results here for me.

I have been having having the same issue. 40 ping normally. Yesterday it was 110, today its steady at 135. I ran "tracert 104.160.131.1" and the response time jumped from ~28ms to 135ms at ae34-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.22]. Does that help?

Ayyyy could I get a full copy of that trace? If there are indeed spikes around riotdirect it could signify a problem, but we'd need the full trace to confirm. Mind shooting me a screenshot instead of copy-pasta?

I don't know if you can send DMs through these boards. I submitted a ticket (#33563949) with the screenshot, but I don't wanna show my IP here. As of this morning, my ping is back down to 40ms at the Riot IP above, but I will keep an eye on it.

Can't DM sadly, but that's a good idea sending it over in a ticket too! I'll be sure to check in on that, and with a ticket the techs will be able to take a look as well ^_^.

Glad to hear that ping is back down, might have been some weird hiccup in routing or something? Hopefully it doesn't start spiking again anytime soon!
Yeah! It does just appear to be a routing error that's corrected itself. Thanks for the quick responses!
I changed the DNS setting and it didn't help. I am running a mac so does that have anything to do with it.
